page.title: 14BEVERTON FARM
page.content: He does not think that he will ever sell the farm or move away and says that he can still easily manage his five acres. He misses the bullocks and in the old days he used to have someone in to help him with the hay making. He still has his old tractor but rarely uses it now. Going into the house was like having the clock turned back a hundred years although I am sure that there must be other farms like this in the area, it is such an enormous contrast to the wealthy large farms with their large flocks of sheep and horses. Strangely he has no dog but a black cat eyed us rather suspiciously while we talked in the kitchen. I just wonder how long such a life style will last, I suppose he will be the last of a generation and after that it will disappear for ever.
